text: Nordstromia argenticeps is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Warren in 1922. It is found in the Khasi Hills of north-eastern India and in Nepal. Adults are similar to Nordstromia sumatrana, except for the shape of the postmedial fascia which is weakly sigmoid.Bulletin of the British Museum (Natural History) (Entomology). Supplement 12: 77 The larvae feed on Rubus species., 2010: Nordstromia guenterriedeli sp. n. from Sumatra (Indonesia) (Lepidoptera: Drepanidae). Entomofauna. 0031: 57-68. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1922 Category:Drepaninae
title: Nordstromia argenticeps
